required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Denosumab Related Osteonecrossi of the Jaw : : an Emergent and Potentially Complex Bone and Joint Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Denosumab Related Osteonecrossi of the Jaw : : an Emergent and Potentially Complex Bone and Joint Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to adescription of mandibular osteomylitis in patients having had a treatment by DENOSUMAB. Indeed, one of the adverse effect ot this molecule is to induce mandibular infection.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Entire description can be made at the outcome which is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption
secondary_outcome.description: Description of the duration and strategies of antibiotic treatments used (double-agent therapy, monotherapy)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined by local clinical and/or microbiological relapse; and/or need for additional surgery; death of septic origin. Analyse of risk factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: management of mandibular osteomyelitis by medical team
secondary_outcome.time_frame: all data are available at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption
secondary_outcome.description: description of medical and surgical strategies : data availables in consultation report

arm_group.description: description of mandibular osteomylitis due to denosumab

study_pop.textblock: patients having a mandibular osteomylelitis due to DENOSUMAB betwwen 01/01/2013 and 31/12/2018 and managed at the Lyon Bone and joint infection refence Center

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients having a mandibular osteomylelitis due to DENOSUMAB
Exclusion Criteria:
- none

condition_browse.mesh_term: Drug-Related Side Effects and Adverse Reactions
